definition: very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit

sentences.english: Basic necessities are often at a premium during a war.
sentences.chinese: 战争时期，基本生活必需品常常奇缺。

sentences.english: Food is deadly wanted in India.
The manager dwelt specially on the great need for funds.
sentences.chinese: 经理特别强调了资金奇缺的问题。

sentences.english: But the new fourth army drug and medical equipment as are scarce.
sentences.chinese: 但新四军的药品及医疗器械照旧奇缺。

sentences.english: There is plentiful fleisch supplied in this region but seldom fresh vegetable and fruits.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区有大量肉类供应，但新鲜果蔬奇缺。

definition: to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
The cleverest housewife cannot cook without rice (idiom); You won't get anywhere without equipment.
pinyin: qiao3 fu4 nan2 wei2 wu2 mi3 zhi1 chui1

definition: lit. many monks and not much gruel (idiom)/fig. not enough to go around/demand exceeds supply
many things waiting to be done (idiom)/a thousand things to do
see 僧多粥少[seng1 duo1 zhou1 shao3]
